thread.title: 23 Hidden Gems At Universal Studios And Islands Of Adventure
thread.title_full: 23 Hidden Gems At Universal Studios And Islands Of Adventure

author: Arielle Calderon
title: 23 Hidden Gems At Universal Studios And Islands Of Adventure
text:
View this image › 
ID: 10681092 1. Outside the Kwik-E-Mart in Springfield at Universal Studios, pick up the phone when it rings and you’ll hear Simpsons characters on the other line. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed It changes every time.
ID: 3288196 2. And at Moe’s Tavern, you can buy a “Flaming Moe” drink — which is basically an orange soda with dry ice. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed On an episode of The Simpsons , Homer tells Moe about a secret alcoholic drink — consisting of cough medicine and fire — deemed “Flaming Homer.” Moe steals the recipe from Homer, renames the drink the “Flaming Moe,” and begins selling it at his tavern.
ID: 3288240 3. Steven Spielberg makes a cameo as a Simpsons character on the Krustyland ride (which was previously the Back to the Future ride). View this image › 
Martin Savelkoul / Creative Commons / Via Flickr: tricktracker He’s in line at a restaurant.
ID: 10628751 4. When you’re on Revenge of the Mummy, to the left in the golden room of hidden treasures, there’s a mini statue of King Kong in memory of the previous ride. View this image › 
Daryl_Mitchelle / Creative Commons / Via Flickr: daryl_mitchell It closed in 2002.
ID: 10628580 5. On the Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit roller coaster, you can hold down the logo on the screen and access a secret playlist. Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed Hold down the logo for about 5-10 seconds, and then when you take your finger off, a keypad will pop up. Enter a random 3-digit code and hit enter, and you’ll be surprised by a song! FYI, 902 is “Rainbow Connection” by The Muppets and 310 is “Vogue” by Madonna.
ID: 10628626 6. The facade of Men in Black pays homage to Flushing Meadows Park in New York and the St. Louis Gateway Arch in Missouri. View this image › 
Jeremy Thompson / BuzzFeed / Via Flickr: rollercoasterphilosophy ID: 10628647 7. The score for the new Jimmy Fallon ride was created by The Roots. Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed Also, it replaced the Twister ride in case you didn’t know!
ID: 10628665 8. In one of the alleys of the New York area of Universal, you’ll see a poster for The Blind Pig, which is the speakeasy in Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them . View this image › 
Trevor Aydelotte / NBCUniversal It’s located in between TRANSFORMERS: The Ride – 3D and Revenge of the Mummy.
ID: 10680761 9. At King’s Cross station, you’ll notice an advertisement for perfume — which is a nod to a scene in the Half-Blood Prince movie. ID: 10681680 10. In the photo booth at the entrance of Diagon Alley, you can dial MAGIC (62442) and it will connect you to the Ministry of Magic. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed ID: 10680725 11. If you stop by 12 Grimmauld Place, you’ll see Kreacher make an appearance in the window. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed ID: 10681710 12. In the window of the apothecary in Diagon Alley, you’ll spot a pair of Jaws teeth in tribute to the ride. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed RIP Jaws.
ID: 10628583 13. Blue Man Group replaced Nickelodeon Studios, but you can still see the green slime tiling in the bathrooms. ← Slide → ID: 10680908 View this image › 
ID: 10681101 14. When in line for the Forbidden Journey ride, you can hear a teacher lecturing behind the Potions classroom door. View this image › 
wizardingworldharrypotter.com There are a ton of references to the movies, so pay attention!
ID: 10681115 15. In the bathrooms at Hogsmeade, you’ll hear Moaning Myrtle’s complaints and cries. View this image › 
Scott Smith / Via Flickr: scottrsmith ID: 10680540 16. At the Hog’s Head pub (inside Three Broomsticks), you can see the talking heads from Prisoner of Azkaban . View this image › 
FPRA / Creative Commons / Via Flickr: fpra ID: 10681123 17. In the Marvel section, you’ll notice that artist Adam Kubert signed his name in all the giant comic book characters. Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed Some are trickier to find than others.
ID: 10628653 18. You can spot Stan Lee four times on the Spider-Man ride. View this image › 
Marvel The first one is at the beginning of the ride; he’s driving a truck and nearly crashes into your car.
ID: 10628572 19. There’s also a hidden Iron Man poster on the wall at the beginning of the ride. View this image › 
Marvel ID: 10628573 20. They recently remodeled the Hulk ride, and Fall Out Boy’s Patrick Stump did the score. View this image › 
blog.universalorlando.com Also, the arching tracks that Hulk is holding at the entrance (pictured above) is actually from the original Hulk attraction.
ID: 10628588 21. The Hulk ride was originally going to be about the Silver Surfer, but creators thought a chrome roller coaster so close to I-4 wasn’t a great idea. View this image › 
Marvel Probably smart since I-4 is already a nightmare.
ID: 10628597 22. The palm trees in Seuss Landing are actually “survivors” from Hurricane Andrew. Universal used them because they were bent and curved, providing a whimsical effect. View this image › 
Arielle Calderon / BuzzFeed ID: 10628748 23. Also in Seuss Landing, Dr. Seuss himself makes a cameo — located by the police officer. Rain0975 / Creative Commons / Via Flickr: rain0975 , seuss.wikia.com He is wearing the glasses, holding the banner.
ID: 10628750 Do you know of more hidden gems? Add them in the comments below! ID: 10681842 24.
